column1: Frontal bossing is seen only in a few rare syndromes, including acromegaly, a chronic disorder caused by too much growth hormone, which leads to enlargement of the bones of the face, jaw, hands, feet, and skull.
Home care for disorders associated with frontal bossing varies with the specific disorder.
An infant or child with frontal bossing generally has other symptoms and signs that, when taken together, define a specific syndrome or condition.
- Has a disorder been identified as the cause of the frontal bossing?
